description:
This is an early morning two vehicle left turn T-intersection crash that occurred on a two
                        way six lane, dry asphalt roadway. The roadway consists of two westbound and two eastbound
                        through lanes that are separated by a continuous left turn lane and a right-turn only eastbound
                        lane. The cross street is a two way, one lane, dry asphalt roadway. The lanes are separated by a
                        painted centerline stripe. The area where the two roadways meet is controlled by a posted stop
                        sign for northbound traffic. The intersection is not controlled for east and westbound traffic.
                        The stop sign was visible at the time of the crash. There were no roadway deficiencies and there
                        was a sight line restriction. The sight line restriction consisted of a non-contact moving
                        school bus traveling eastbound and slowing down to turn right onto the southbound road. There
                        were no adverse weather conditions and the weather was clear. The speed limit on the through
                        street is posted 89 kmph (55 mph) The speed limit on the cross street is posted 72 kmph (45
                        mph).


                        Vehicle one (V1), a 1994 Chevrolet pickup, driven by a 38 year-old female with one passenger was
                        traveling southbound approaching the through cross street. The driver stopped for the stop sign
                        and then entered the intersection and began to turn left to travel westbound. V1 began to make
                        the left turn as a non-contact school bus was slowing down to make a right turn. The V1 driver's
                        line of sight was apparently restricted by the bus making the right turn. The left side of V1
                        and the front of V2 collided in the eastbound lanes. The impact caused V1 to rotate clockwise
                        and a side slap between the left side of V1 and right side of V2 occurred. V1 departed the
                        impacts on an eastbound trajectory and V1 ultimately departed the right side of the roadway and
                        came to rest in a field facing generally south. V1 was towed due to damage. Driver and passenger
                        were transported to a local medical facility.


                        Vehicle two (V2), a 2002 Bluebird school bus, driven by a 54 year-old male with one passenger
                        was traveling eastbound in the number one lane at approximately 72 kmph (45 mph). There was a
                        non-contact school bus traveling in the right turn lane slowing down to turn right at the
                        intersection. The driver stated that he noticed V1 making a left turn in front of his vehicle,
                        but had not seen V1 stopped at the stop sign. The driver applied the brakes but was unable to
                        stop before the front of V2 and the left side of V1 collided. After impact with V1, the driver
                        of brought his vehicle to a controlled stop on the north shoulder. V2 was towed due to damage.
                        The driver and passenger of V2 were transported to a local medical facility.


                        The critical pre crash event for V1 was coded this vehicle traveling, turning left at
                        intersection . The critical reason for the critical event was coded to V1 as a driver decision
                        factor: turned with obstructed view. The driver's view was obstructed by a school bus turning
                        right directly in the line of sight of the driver's view of the V2.


                        The critical event for V2 was coded: other vehicle encroachment; from crossing street, turning
                        into opposite direction . The critical reason was not coded to this vehicle.
